briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon/evening. We will now commence the climate briefing for January 19, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Climate Crisis Warnings and Immediate Challenges
sections.content: Several reports released today once again underscore the severity of the climate crisis and the immediate challenges it presents. In Chile, at least 18 people have died due to large-scale wildfires, and a state of national disaster has been declared [144]. Domestically, in Naju, a tomato blight caused by abnormal weather conditions is spreading [56]. The nature of disaster sites is also changing due to climate change, with a decrease in beehive removal incidents and an increase in heat-related illnesses, necessitating an urgent new response system [9, 40]. Furthermore, there is a high probability that global warming will reach 2Â°C before 2050 [159], accompanied by warnings that the climate goals of the Paris Agreement may collapse prematurely, and criticisms that fossil fuel companies are playing a key role in driving this crisis [35, 156].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Domestic Companies and Local Governments' Efforts in Climate Change Adaptation and Response
sections.content: Amidst these crises, domestic companies and local governments are demonstrating positive movements towards climate change response. LS Cable & System has earned a 'Leadership' rating (A-) in the CDP (Carbon Disclosure Project) climate change response assessment, the only one in the domestic industry, proving its global ESG competitiveness [2, 14, 29, 42]. Shinsung E&G also received a 'B' rating in the CDP climate change assessment, acknowledging its global response capabilities [4, 16, 47]. At the local government level, the Gyeongbuk Agricultural Research and Extension Services has developed 5 new climate change-adaptive flower varieties, enhancing the agricultural sector's resilience [1, 13, 28]. Gangneung City is accelerating its efforts to transform parks and green spaces into healing areas to combat climate change [5, 25, 60]. Dongdaemun-gu has contributed to the establishment of carbon neutrality in the local community by winning the Social Value Award for its 'Carbon Neutrality in Everyday Life' activities [69, 71, 78].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Expansion of Renewable Energy and Efforts to Achieve Carbon Neutrality Goals
sections.content: Efforts to expand renewable energy for achieving carbon neutrality goals are also continuing. Yeoju City has been selected for the New and Renewable Energy Convergence Support Project for six consecutive years, securing national funding and contributing to local energy independence [95, 108, 123]. Chungcheongbuk-do Province has also signed a business agreement to accelerate the dissemination of renewable energy, thereby speeding up electricity self-sufficiency [109, 126]. Korea Southern Power (KOSPO) is continuing its efforts to expand renewable energy, including promoting a power generation project utilizing livestock manure and accelerating safety management at the Solaseado Solar Power Plant site [82, 94, 116]. Kolon Industries has fully activated renewable energy since the beginning of the year, launching its ESG strategy, and Haezoom has completed a 2.4MW solar power plant at Kolon Industries' Gumi factory [120, 121, 122]. Furthermore, international cooperation is strengthening, with South Korea and Sweden forming an alliance in clean energy sectors such as SMRs, offshore wind power, and power grids [70, 83, 96, 139].

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Community's Perception of Climate Change and Policy Discussions
sections.content: In the international community, diverse perceptions and policy discussions regarding climate change are underway. Amidst analyses suggesting that Greenland's value is increasing due to global warming [10, 67], news of the world's second-largest emitter withdrawing from a greenhouse gas reduction system reiterates the importance of international cooperation [11]. Reports indicating that the United States is pursuing fossil fuel-centric energy policies while Asia is driving a renewable energy-centric energy transition highlight regional disparities in energy transition efforts [98]. Companies are warned that climate change-related 'blind spots' are transforming into liabilities on balance sheets [151], and in the Middle East, there are calls for adaptation strategies to lead the energy transition in response to accelerating climate change [152]. Meanwhile, an analysis from the UK suggests that opposing views in newspaper editorials on climate action have for the first time surpassed supportive views, emphasizing the importance of social consensus on climate policy [162].

briefing.closing: Today's briefing has simultaneously highlighted the reality of the climate crisis and the diverse domestic and international efforts to combat it. This is a time that calls for sustained attention and effort. This concludes today's climate briefing.
